column1: Figure 4. Comparison of percent of U.S. residents age 12 or older who were victims of serious crime, 2014 and 2018
Data source: Bureau of Justice Statistics, National Crime Victimization Survey, 2014 and 2018.
Authors: Rachel E. Morgan, Ph.D., and Barbara A. Oudekerk, Ph.D., BJS Statisticians
Figure 4. Comparison of percent of U.S. residents age 12 or older who were victims of serious crime, 2014 and 2018
Note: See table 20 for serious-crime definitions and estimates and appendix table 4 for standard errors. Differences shown are significant at a 95% confidence level except where otherwise indicated.
‡Significant difference from 2014 to 2018 at the 90% confidence level.
Source: Bureau of Justice Statistics, National Crime Victimization Survey, 2014 and 2018.
